revised_title: Submarine Pillow Lavas and Their Formation in Eastern Sicily
tldr: The authors studied the morphology and recent development of submarine pillow lavas in the Catania area, eastern Sicily, during the 1971 eruption of Mount Etna. They observed the transition from subaerial to submarine lava flows and examined the role of sea water in the formation of pillows. The study provides insights into the evolution of the Earth's crust and the contribution of submarine lavas to the bulk chemistry of the hydrosphere.
